intro: Lippia graveolens f. microphylla, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant is shrub-like, with small, narrow leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
